name: Grell
lore: A grell resembles a giant floating brain with a sharp beak and ten long, barbed tentacles. This alien predator lurks in dark caverns and ruins, hovering silently before dropping on unsuspecting prey. Grells are solitary hunters with inscrutable motivations, their alien minds nearly impossible to read or influence.

traits.name: Alien Mind
traits.description: If a creature tries to read the grell's thoughts or deals Psychic damage to it, that creature must succeed on a DC 11 Intelligence saving throw or have the Stunned condition for 1 minute. The Stunned creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

multiattack.description: The grell makes one Beak attack and one Tentacles attack.

actions.name: Beak
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) Piercing damage.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 10 ft. Hit: 8 (1d12 + 2) Piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) Lightning damage, and the target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 12). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition, and the target takes 3 (1d6) Lightning damage at the start of each of its turns. The grell can grapple only one creature at a time.

hit.additionalEffects: While Grappled, the target takes 3 (1d6) Lightning damage at the start of each of its turns. The grell can grapple only one creature at a time.
